The Director Digital Platforms, Field & Customer Solutions (F&CS) is a high impact role within the DePuy Synthes North America Supply Chain organization that leads the team responsible for the development and management of our Orthopedic digital solution platforms. These solutions, which currently include Advance Case Management (ACM), eSIMS, and Set Tracking, provide AI enabled pre-op planning, case coordination, on-site inventory management, and field asset and set utilization visibility. These capabilities drive a differentiated experience that delivers operational, commercial, and customer benefits. This director will be a key technical and strategic leader responsible for the growth and success of these digital solution.

Are you interested in making a difference in a thriving diverse company culture, that celebrates the uniqueness of our employees and is committed to inclusion Apply today!

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead a team of six individuals responsible for the day-to-day and long-term management of existing digital solutions.
  • Demonstrate strong leadership in the development and execution of the solution strategies aligning with business goals and market demands.
  • Maintain comprehensive product roadmaps outlining key milestones, feature releases, and product updates. Drive feature prioritization efforts across stakeholders based on field, business, customer, and partner feedback, organizational dynamics, and business objectives.
  • Facilitate and drive significant collaboration with cross-functional teams, including Software Engineering, Design, Quality Assurance, R&D, Legal, Compliance, Data Science, and Commercial Operations to define product requirements and ensure timely delivery of high-quality solutions and analytics.
  • Define and measure key performance indicators (KPIs) and regularly assess the success of the solutions.
  • Utilize data analytics to identify areas for improvement and optimize product performance.
  • Stay abreast of industry trends and continually evaluate new technologies and alternatives to existing products and processes. Identify opportunities for platform enhancements and new features.
  • Responsible for driving vendor and partner relationships and managing related budgets.
  • Spearheads efforts to integrate digital solutions with other DPS Commercial products and services.
  • Supports the development and management of other digital solutions and participates in other company projects and initiatives as required.
  • Supports solution deployment planning and execution as required.

Qualifications

Qualifications

Education:

  • A minimum of a bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or Business is required; a MBA or other Graduate degree preferred.

Experience and Skills:

Required:

  • A minimum of 10+ years working experience in any of the following areas required - Sales, Marketing, Supply Chain, Finance, Digital Health, IT, or Engineering.
  • 8+ years of healthcare industry experience is required
  • 5+ years of people management experience with direct reports is required.
  • Strong collaboration, partnering, and negotiation skills required
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills required.
  • Ability to work independently with strong and flexible work ethic required
  • Excellent Planning & Organizing Skills required

Preferred:

  • Demonstrated ability to effectively recruit, develop, manage and coach associates is highly desirable.
  • Previous experience with project management is preferred.
  • Experience managing cross functional teams/projects/initiatives preferred.
  • Healthcare industry/environment experience preferred.
  • J&J Med Tech product and system knowledge preferred.
  • Knowledge of orthopedic products preferred

Other:

Job Title: Senior Director, Oncology Key Accounts
Job Description:
Description

Johnson & Johnson, is recruiting for the Senior Director, Oncology Key Accounts, located in Horsham, PA.

We are Johnson & Johnson. Our mission drives us. Our patients inspire us. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it.  For more than 30 years, Johnson & Johnson has delivered on the promise of new treatments and ways to improve the health of individuals with serious disease. Built upon a rich legacy of innovative firsts, Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine pursues innovative solutions in the therapeutic areas of immunology, oncology, urology and nephrology. With the same unwavering passion for new challenges, we dedicate ourselves to delivering solutions for these disease states where unmet needs continue to exist.  Rooted in rich scientific collaborations and community-based relationships, we have access to some of the top minds in science today, allowing us to advance the treatment of patients through our innovative medicines. Our discoveries lead us not only to new treatments, but also to new ways to empower patients and expand their access to quality care.  For more about Johnson & Johnson, visit home.jnj.com.

Join us at JNJ as the Senior Director for Oncology Key Accounts, a pivotal role driving key account strategy across our esteemed portfolio of Oncology brands. You'll lead a dynamic team overseeing both the Key Account Management team for our entire oncology portfolio and the Urology Business Account Management team for our GU portfolio.

Your mission will be to craft an integrated strategic plan that creates access to our portfolio and drives growth of our brands.  You’ll develop influential relationships with National KOLs and Population Health Decision Makers within designated national customers, academic centers, and community oncology networks.  Together, we'll navigate the changing market landscape, adapting to evolving payment models and pathways.

You'll forge strong partnerships with our marketing teams, sales teams, and the Strategic Customer Group (SCG). Collaborating closely with Oncology Sales leadership, you'll secure access to our portfolio, champion account-specific brand goals, and drive alignment across our local oncology account teams. Working hand in hand with SCG, you'll maximize our account management effectiveness, fine-tune performance dashboards, and optimize platforms.

In conjunction with brand marketing leads and SCG, you'll refine our key account strategies, developing annual Business Plans to maximize our expanding Oncology portfolio. Your insights will shape our long-term strategic plan, ensuring alignment with the evolving oncology marketplace and key account priorities.

Your role demands close collaboration with various functions including Sales, Sales Training, Medical Affairs, and Real-World Value & Evidence. Upholding our Value Excellence principles and practices, you'll lead the staffing, training, and development of our Key Account team members.

Utilizing market research, you'll orchestrate Oncology key account activities and synchronize efforts with sales management. Partnering with Sales Training, you'll ensure our teams are equipped with up-to-date product knowledge. You'll lead customer engagements for key accounts, fostering effective interactions with core Oncology leadership and other key stakeholders.

As a strategic thinker with a keen eye for detail, you'll navigate the competitive landscape within regulatory guidelines. Working closely with senior leadership, you'll ensure we're poised to capitalize on both short-term and long-term business opportunities.

Qualifications

•             BA/BS required, MBA preferred

•             A minimum of 10 years progressive industry experience, including a minimum of 3 years account management experience, and proven performance is required.

•             Demonstrated people management experience with excellent leadership skills and the ability to work effectively in a matrix and unstructured environment.

•             Demonstrated experience in critical account management competencies required.

•             Previous Pharmaceutical Industry experience required.

•             Demonstrated leadership capabilities required.

•             People management responsibilities required with 2nd line people leadership preferred.

•             Oncology & market access experience strongly preferred.

•             Global or In-line Pharmaceutical Marketing experience is preferred.

•             Requires up to 25% travel, predominantly US with limited OUS travel.

Employees may be eligible to participate in Company employee benefit programs such as health insurance, savings plan, pension plan, disability plan, long term incentives, vacation pay, sick time, holiday pay, and work, personal and family time off in accordance with the terms of the applicable plans.  Additional information can be found through the link below.

Job Title: IT Lead - ServiceNow Solutions Architect / Technical Product Owner
Job Description:
Description

Johnson & Johnson is recruiting for an IT Lead - ServiceNow Solutions Architect / Technical Product Owner to be located in New Brunswick, NJ or Raritan, NJ.

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

This role will lead the GS Service Management Transformation Products. Leading the delivery and support of the ServiceNow Platform, supporting key capabilities which enable the HR, Procurement and Finance global services with focus on the Employee Experience. You will lead the daily execution and delivery from start to completion – including deadlines, achievements, communication, and processes and keep deployments on track. As a solutions architect, your key focus will be designing and delivering technology solutions to the business, working closely with business and technology partners to prioritize critical implementation dates. You will be the technical lead focusing on development technical and product owner relationships, driving an agile delivery team, and develop/maintain product roadmaps. You should have good technical team leadership qualities and experience, as well as excellent business partnering, and interpersonal skills. As a Technical Product Owner (TPO), you will take end-to-end ownership of the ServiceNow SMT (Service Management Transformation) products and initiatives and collaborate with and influences a broad range of multi-disciplinary teams such as Software Developers, Business SMEs, QA, Testers, and Analysts.

If you have previous experience in product and software development, implementation of ServiceNow enterprise platform, software integrations, naturally curious, have a drive for technology, comfortable with ambiguity, leading complex relationships, and influencing other senior peers in other groups, bringing an excellent consulting and long-term planning insights, and are passionate about improving our employee’s lives, we encourage you to apply today!

Responsibilities:


Technical Guidance and Collaboration:

  • Utilize in-depth knowledge of the ServiceNow platform, particularly in HRSD, S2P and Employee Center modules, to guide development teams.
  • Design, architect, and implement scalable, robust, and secure solutions on the ServiceNow platform to meet the organization's business requirements and align with ServiceNow best practices.
  • Design and implement integrations between ServiceNow and other enterprise systems, ensuring seamless data flow and interoperability.
  • Collaborate closely with developers, administrators, and SI partners to implement and configure solutions.
  • Lead strategy, backlog prioritization, and configuration efforts alongside the IT delivery team.

Product Ownership and Backlog Management:

  • Take ownership of the ServiceNow HRSD and Procurement Operations (S2P) products backlogs within the SMT (Service Management Transformation) Program.
  • Prioritize features and define user stories in alignment with HR service delivery and S2P Procurement Operations strategies.
  • Collaborate with Global Services (GS), HR, IT, and Procurement stakeholders to gather requirements and feedback.
  • Act as the “voice of the customer” within the squad to ensure the team “builds the right thing."

Agile Implementation:

  • Implement agile principles and practices in product development.
  • Conduct sprint planning, backlog refinement, and sprint review events.
  • Supervise progress of product development and drive continuous improvement within the team.

Stakeholder Management and Communication:

  • Conduct product demos and Proof of Concepts (POCs) to showcase solutions.
  • Maintain strong focus on user experience within ServiceNow solutions.
  • Work closely with UX/UI designers to enhance usability and effectiveness.
  • Communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders

Leadership and Collaboration:

  • Act as primary trusted delivery advisor to technology leaders.
  • Collaborate across multiple global/regional teams and JJT groups.
  • Partner with external organizations and vendors to influence enhancements and functionality.

Measurement and Reporting:

  • Utilize data analytics and KPIs to make informed decisions about HRSD features.
  • Implement metrics tracking and reporting to measure success and impact.
  • Apply value realization for new technology solutions and ensure alignment with product vision and roadmap.

External Partnerships and Vendor Management:

  • Handle vendor relationships to influence product features.
  • Collaborate with external partners to influence direction of enhancements.

Platform Strategy and Design:

  • Develop business-centric, technical platform strategy to drive measurable business value.
  • Influence platform-first and Out-of-the-Box design strategy.
  • Help with transitioning from Program to Product once the initial solution implementation is completed.

Qualifications

Required :

  • Bachelor's degree
  • Minimum of 5+ years of experience with ServiceNow Platform and Products, including prior HR Service Delivery (HRSD) and/or Source-to-pay implementation experience.
  • At least one ServiceNow Certification (CSA, CIS-HR, etc)
  • Proven track record in leading and owning technology investments and products, defining and measuring product outcomes and metrics.
  • Strong proponent of change, advocating for improvements within and across the organization.
  • Experience with end-to-end design of customer needs, roadmap creation, and execution of data-connected products following design thinking and user experimentation principles.
  • Developed leadership capabilities, negotiation skills, and attention to detail.
  • Strong relationship skills, effective communication, excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex technical ideas to diverse audiences.

Preferred :

  • Minimum 2 years of experience in creating, implementing, and leading technical products and capacity-based development teams in a fast-paced Agile environment.
  • Proficiency in using agile project management tools such as JIRA and Confluence.
  • Experience working in a global environment
  • Knowledge with ServiceNow data integrations including REST APIs, Spokes and Integration Hub.
  • Knowledge with Genesys Cloud and ServiceNow Integrations.
  • Experience with Employee Service Center and portal solutions.
  • Knowledge with SN Advanced Work Assignment and Workforce Optimization products.

The anticipated base pay range for this position is $90,000- $144,900.

Job Title: Director, Enterprise Events & Activations
Job Description:
Description

Johnson & Johnson is currently recruiting for a Director, Enterprise Events & Activations to join our team in New Brunswick, NJ.

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything! Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

This position reports to the Leader, Global Event Management. The Director, Enterprise Events & Activations is an enabler of successful global experiences – providing focused management and the ability to lead and implement customized end-to-end novel solutions tailored to each meeting and event. The Director, Enterprise Events & Activations is a strategic advisor who brings forward creative, boundary-pushing ideas, knowledge of designed experiences, production/staging, and transforms them into dynamic, engaging outcomes.

Key Responsibilities:

Project management

Oversees the work of two Senior Project Managers that lead C Suite and Executive Committee level meetings/events globally. Events range in size up to 100,000+ people.

Manages specific events individually with the assistance of other resources to deliver end to end events

Ability to understand multiple business sector/functions vision, needs and requirements

Display strategic planning, meeting management, and people leader skills:

  • Provides comprehensive scope and project objectives
  • Establishes clear roles and responsibilities for project team members
  • Sets, communicates, and drives project timelines
  • Leads onsite project management (live or virtual); motivates and supports staff
  • Handles production: live and virtual, exhibits, registration, rehearsals

Requires risk management experience and strong negotiations skills

Oversees complex budget management

Leads specific Enterprise projects that include but are not limited to:

  • C Suite hosted events globally
  • Overflow planning of EC events (Large & Small events, Webcasts, Retirement Dinner, Receptions etc..)
  • Local Activations (NB based programming)
  • Oversight & decision making of various Enterprise Award Programs

Requires decision making responsibilities for specific projects in addition to overseeing the teams responsibilities.

Partners with Senior Director on various Enterprise programming globally

People management

Responsible for all people leaders assessments (5 performance conversations), development & training)

Responsible for (2) senior project managers that delivers travel logistics for the Johnson & Johnson Board of Director & EC meetings & events which include the following areas:

Registration, hospitality and logistics

Database and registration management (including onsite registration management & badging)

Airport operations and air travel (including Corporate Aviation)

Amenities, uniforms and gifts (including selection, collation, distribution & warehousing)

Décor and entertainment (including production and staging)

Food and beverage (including menu development, guarantees, BEO’s)

Function and hospitality space (including room layouts, space planning & CAD drawings)

Hotel accommodations (including allocation, assignments, check-in/out, luggage, payments)

Logistics (including scheduling, deliveries, load-in/load-out)

Travel (including partnership with agencies, visa processing & letters of invitations)

Tours (including free-time activities, excursions, customized options)

Transportation (including fleet, drivers, routes, schedules, parking, permits)

Ground transportation management (commercial & Corporate Fleet, air fare analysis)

Vendor and committee liaison (including DMC, hotel, and various vendors)

Offsite hospitality (themed events, dine-arounds, venue rentals, offsite special events)

VIP program management (including Board of Directors, Chairman’s Office, customers)

Procurement (including hotels, staffing, destination management companies (DMC’s), communication & promotional items

Staffing Management (procurement, selection, & training)

Conducts site inspections for all offsite events and meetings

Works closely with Corporate Medical and Security Departments

Production & Design

Requires strong production management and oversight of planning agenda including:

  • RFPs for production and graphic design agencies
  • Webcasting, streaming, engagement tools, filming – live and pre-recorded. Green screen recordings, Zoom recordings and webinars
  • Runs agency deadlines for presentations, scripts, and graphic design
  • Full run-of-show elements
  • Scheduling of rehearsals, makeup, and teleprompting
  • Production (including staging/exhibits, graphic design, and all audio visual support)
  • Work closely with in-house resources, TV studio & video production and J&J facilities
  • Liaise with communications partners (including communication strategy plan/event marketing)
  • Event content and design kick-off meetings
  • Works closely with Sr. Visual Strategist

Enable redesigned, reimagined on-site and virtual branded experiences

  • Implement branded experiences – exterior, interiors, digital and print – for global projects and events
  • Guide external vendors in the production of immersive hybrid experiences, exhibits, and spaces
  • Handle event registration and websites
  • Coordinate with design and project leads to deliver digital communications and promotions
  • Mobile experience

Technology: hybrid meeting experiences

  • Leads hybrid events
  • Knowledge of virtual event platforms, registration solutions and third party applications (Poll Everywhere, CVENT, etc)
  • Advances creative hybrid solutions; open to new ideas and services
  • Works closely with Sr. Technical Strategist

Qualifications

Education:

  • Bachelors required

Experience and Skills:

Required:

  • 10 Years of Fortune 100 Planning Experience
  • People Leader Experience, Project Management, Budget Management & Reconciliation, Verbal & Written Communication Skills, Performance Management.
  • High degree of independent judgement required
  • High degree of confidence, problem solving & independent judgement in regular business situations
  • Proven relationships with event design and production agencies required
  • Experience and cultural understanding of global markets and event practices oversees in the luxury market
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Must be detail oriented, team player, self-starter and able to produce quality work in a fast-paced environment

Preferred:

  • Prior hotel experience preferred but not required

Other:

  • Percentage of global travel 35-50%

Salary:

The compensation and benefits information set forth in this posting applies to candidates hired in the United States. Candidates hired outside the United States will be eligible for compensation and benefits in accordance with their local market.

The base pay range for this position is $137,000 -$235,750.

Bonus:

The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/ performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis.

Benefits:

  • Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance.
  • Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company’s consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)).
  • Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits:
  • Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar year
  • Sick time - up to 40 hours per calendar year; for employees who reside in the State of Washington – up to 56 hours per calendar year
  • Holiday pay, including Floating Holidays – up to 13 days per calendar year
  • Work, Personal and Family Time - up to 40 hours per calendar year

For additional general information on Company benefits, please go to:

  • https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefit

Job Description:
Description

Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine is recruiting for a Director, Marketing Operations to be located in Horsham, PA. At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

Job Title: Senior Clinical Data Analyst
Job Description:
Description

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

Biosense Webster, Inc is recruiting for a Senior Clinical Data Analyst, to be based at anywhere is united states.

Biosense Webster, Inc. is the global leader in the science of diagnosing and treating heart rhythm disorders. The company established its leadership in electrophysiology with the development of the first real-time, 3D cardiac mapping and navigation technology, as well as the first electrophysiology catheter. The introduction of the company’s CARTO® 3 System in 2009 revolutionized 3D mapping technology by increasing the accuracy, speed, and efficiency of the cardiac ablation procedure.

Responsibilities include coordination of timelines and resources required to implement and maintain a variety of clinical systems as well as provide oversight and coordination of all aspects of the development and management of clinical study databases across a variety of platforms.  Coordination of activities will require the development of strong, productive relationships with colleagues across the MD sector.   This individual performs with little to no supervision.

POSITION DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Collaborate with Data Management leadership (including Programming and Biostatistics) to define and document data and process standards;
  • Provide in-house project support for creation, routing and approval of all system deliverables associated with clinical systems;
  • Support the development and maintenance of global harmonized processes and procedures for system support;
  • Support vendor evaluation, selection, contracting, and oversight activities for outsourced systems; Assist with vendor evaluation and selection activities for clinical systems;
  • Work with BSDM partners, and leadership in Clinical Operations and Franchise to develop project management plans for trial execution including timelines and milestones for study-specific systems set-up, UAT, maintenance and closeout as required;
  • Lead project management activity related to Electronic Data Capture (EDC) Systems, CTMS, eTMF and other relevant platforms (as assigned);
  • Create, review and facilitate approval of system deliverables and facilitate appropriate quality review where applicable;
  • Mentor peers through review of deliverables to minimize delays during the quality review process;
  • Interface between Clinical R&D, IT and Quality including CSV regarding clinical systems, UAT, processes and other tools;
  • Facilitate  support requests associated with clinical systems (as needed);
  • Serve as first line of contact from study initiation through go live for each clinical study. Systems may include: CTMS, eTMF, EDCs;
  • Facilitate the development of training materials and programs related to system set-up, UAT and ongoing maintenance as well as other relevant processes;
  • Represent the Medical Devices Sector on Enterprise or cross-sector Clinical System teams (as needed);
  • Assist with the implementation of study metrics;
  • Analyzes complex change requests to determine feasibility for incorporation within clinical studies;
  • Evaluates vendor supplied release documentation for implementation feasibility and collaborate with appropriate partners to define project parameters;

Qualifications

·       A Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in Statistics , Computer Science or related discipline (required),

·       Minimum of 4 years of system support in clinical research

·       experience within Medical Device or Pharmaceuticals is preferred

·       Strong proficiency with the Medidata Rave EDC required, proficiency in custom functions and tSDV plan development preferred;

·       Knowledge of CTMS and eTMF is preferred;

·       Previous experience in Clinical Operations preferred;

·       Demonstrated ability to manage a project in a team environment to deliver critical milestones;

·       Strong proficiency in more than one Clinical system. Advanced certification preferred;

·       Experience with CDISC STDM preferred;

·       Excellent verbal and written communication skills;

·       Knowledge of GCP and SDLC;

This job posting is anticipated to close on 6/15/2024.  The Company may however extend this time-period, in which case the posting will remain available on https://www.careers.jnj.com to accept additional applications.

The anticipated base salary for this position is $88,000 to $123,000

Job Title: Senior Manager, Academic Alliances
Job Description:
Description

Johnson & Johnson is currently seeking a Senior Manager, Academic Alliances to join our Medical Education team to be remotely based in the United States.

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

Reporting into the MedTech Education group, the Senior Manager, Academic Alliances is responsible for developing and supervising the strategy and execution of engagement and support for key Academic Medical Centers in the education of orthopaedic residents and fellows across the MedTech product portfolio. The Senior Manager will lead a team of 5 employees/contractors and work closely with Platform Education Teams, Commercial Teams, Sales, Health Care Professionals, Professional Relations, Medical Affairs and specialty societies to develop and coordinate curriculum for company sponsored Professional Education events of varying sizes.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Develop strategic plans and identify associated tactics to integrate new product and technology solutions into resident/fellow educational programs that support broader organizational objectives.
  • Assist WW Director in creation of value prop messaging for Academic Medical Centers related to our educational offering and how to differentiate from competitive offerings.
  • Work with specialty societies in support of their resident and fellow curriculum aligned to our product training plans.
  • Proactively communicate with and accept feedback from field sales, strategic account group, marketing, and other associated teams to ensure training programs are effective and fully aligned with overall business strategies and goals.
  • Prepare reports, slides, and recommendations to ensure standard processes are shared with the Global Leadership Team.
  • Maintain familiarity with opposing vendors’ activities, treatment trends, technology, and new regulations that may present opportunities or threats to the company.
  • Evaluate and recommend acquisition or implementation of new training methods or technologies that meets the need of the learner and expand the learning continuum such as web-based applications and digital tools.
  • Collaborate with MedTech Professional Education platform leads to establish and implement personalized learning journeys and other online learning opportunities tailored to residents and fellows.
  • Partner with platform leads to seamlessly incorporate Future Leaders education offerings related to platform needs
  • Partner with SCG to implement Value Prop of our differentiated Future Leaders resident and fellows Ed Tech Solutions to external customers.
  • Partner with commercial Customer Experience group to ensure seamless integration of education into external communication pathways.
  • Use data to track results, point to successes and roadblocks, and define solutions
  • Assist WW Director and EdTech LT in communicating our Resident and Fellows strategy.

Qualifications

Qualifications:

  • A minimum of a bachelor’s degree is required, Master’s Degree preferred.
  • Minimum of 5-8 years in healthcare or medical device roles such as Marketing, Product Management, Professional Education, Sales Training; or other applicable experience required.
  • Experience building, cultivating and expanding external partnerships preferred
  • Ability to negotiate and find mutually agreeable solutions
  • Comfort with ambiguity in both strategic and tactical matters.
  • Prioritization and decision-making in complex situations with opposing inputs.
  • Consistent record to lead across multi-functional teams
  • Strong data analysis skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Leadership, ownership, self-motivation, and drive to deliver results in dynamic, constantly evolving environments.
  • Ability to handle a dynamic workload.
  • Maturity and tact in handling interpersonal dynamics.
  • Appetite for rolling up sleeves and getting hands dirty in executing and collaborating. We’re all player coaches, so don’t expect to delegate the work to someone else.
  • Consistent record of success in collaborating with team members across functions and tenures.
  • Willing to work in cadaveric lab settings.
  • Travel up to 50%

The anticipated base pay range for this position is $118,000 to $203,550. The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/ performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis.

Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance. Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company’s consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)).

Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits:

  • Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar year
  • Sick time - up to 40 hours per calendar year; for employees who reside in the State of Washington – up to 56 hours per calendar year
  • Holiday pay, including Floating Holidays – up to 13 days per calendar year
  • Work, Personal and Family Time - up to 40 hours per calendar year

Job Title: Part Time Clinical Consultant - Knoxville
Job Description:
Description

Abiomed, Inc. part of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, is recruiting for a Part-Time Clinical Consultant located in Knoxville, TN.

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/ .

The Part-Time Clinical Consultant (PTCC) role is an exciting opportunity to join Abiomed, one of the industry's fast-growing medical device companies. This role is the first step for Nurses, Advanced Practice Providers, and Cardiology or Radiology Techs to join our world-class field organization. This part-time position will be responsible for providing case support, patient management, and education to both new and existing accounts within an assigned Franchise/Region.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Acquire and demonstrate a working knowledge of our products/therapies and develop an understanding of their applications.
  • Improve patient outcomes by delivering Impella® education in a variety of settings, including but not limited to, the ICU, OR, and Cath Lab.
  • Impella® case support, including on-call support.
  • Completing proactive rounds for patients receiving support and assistance.
  • Collaborate with the Clinical Support Center (CSC) for ongoing additional support as necessary.
  • Maintain clinical competency in current product line, patient management, and remain up to date on most relevant information through continual learning and education.
  • Some travel may be needed.

Qualifications

  • Clinical certification is required; a Registered Nurse (RN)/Advanced Practice Provider (APP) license is strongly preferred.
  • 3+ years’ experience with a strong clinical background in the Cardiac ICU (CICU), Cardiovascular ICU (CVICU), Cardiovascular OR (CVOR), or Catheterization Lab (Cath Lab) required. CVICU experience is highly preferred.
  • Some industry experience is preferred, but not required.
  • Significant experience with Impella® is required (minimum of 10 cases/patients supported).
  • Must provide a minimum of (2) days of live support within the field (case support, patient rounding, providing education), with a total of (5) days of availability per month.
  • Availability must include (1) weekend per month.
  • Ability to work on weekends, nights, holidays as well as weekdays.
  • Ability to work at other hospitals aside from base location.

The hourly rate for this role is $60/hr.

Job Title: Preclinical Laboratory Technician
Job Description:
Description

Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

The Preclinical Laboratory Operations Expert in Preclinical Affairs will work within the animal facilities of Johnson & Johnson MedTech locations in Santa Clara, CA and Redwood City, CA.

These facilities support the execution of preclinical studies required to competitively position robotic and digital solutions for regulatory approval and clinical acceptance. This is a hands-on role within the Preclinical and Clinical Engineering teams and represents an outstanding opportunity to work cross functionally with various groups that utilize the Clinical Labs. Assistance and support in this space will be essential to the development of Ethicon’s highly innovative digital surgery platform.

POSITION DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Under supervision of the Test Facility Manager and in accordance with all applicable federal, state, and local laws/regulations and Corporate Johnson & Johnson, procedures and guidelines, this position will:

·       Support the successful execution of laboratory research studies and research activities.

·       Ensure all required laboratory supplies, tools, instruments are in inventory.

·       Assisting with successful lab event coordination.

·       Assisting with all vendor account management and fostering relationships for ongoing laboratory needs.

·       Assisting with cadaveric tissue and biohazardous waste management.

·       Promoting environmental health and safety compliance in our labs per company policies.

·       Assisting in reviewing and revising Lab SOP’s on a quarterly basis or when necessary.

·       Ensure routine calibration and maintenance of laboratory equipment is coordinated to ensure all resources meet satisfactory requirements of usage.

·       Performs other duties assigned as needed.

Qualifications

·       Bachelor’s Degree preferred but not required.

·       Experience in a biotech laboratory environment is desirable.

·       Some technical understanding of how to operate and handle various laboratory equipment is desired.

·       Experience working in medical device or pharmaceutical research is advantageous.

·       Some understanding of clinical anatomy and surgical methods is helpful.

·       Familiarity with GLP requirements is advantageous.

·       Interest and ability to learn surgical procedures in the Preclinical Lab environment.

·       Attention to detail and good verbal and written communication skills are required.

·       Familiarity working with Microsoft 365 applications such as Word, Excel and PowerPoint is required.

·       Ability to work independently and as part of a project team.

·       Proven organizational and time management skills are essential.

·       Comfortable handling and working with cadaveric and animal tissue is essential.

·       Demonstrated experience working with GLP under 21 CFR 58.

PHYSICAL WORKING CONDITIONS / REQUIREMENTS

·       Ability to lift up to 40 lbs

·       Be able to perform such duties as mopping floors, wiping down lab surfaces

·       Shipping, receiving and storing Cadaveric tissue and laboratory supplies

·       Assembly of laboratory furniture and equipment

LOCATION & TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS

·       Primary location of the position can be at either Johnson & Johnson MedTech animal facilities (Santa Clara, CA and Redwood City, CA). Regular travel back and forth between the two locations is required on a recurring basis.

·       Domestic travel may be occasionally required for training purposes (<10%).

This job posting is anticipated to close on 6/13/2024.  The Company may however extend this time-period, in which case the posting will remain available on https://www.careers.jnj.com to accept additional applications.

The anticipated base salary for this position is $55,000 to $77,000

Job Description:
Description

Janssen Pharmaceuticals, Inc., Neuroscience, a member of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting for a Product Director, Professional Education for Neuroscience Mood to be located in Titusville, NJ

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. The Product Director, Neuroscience Mood will lead Professional Education to build knowledge and skills associated with product and operational considerations. The Product Director will be an integral leader within our Neuroscience marketing organization with significant collaboration across our brand, medical, and commercial field teams.

Key Responsibilities Include:

  • Developing strategies, innovative tactics, and content for peer-to-peer education to shape treatment of Treatment Resistant Depression (and MDSI) across identified stakeholders and special populations. Education priorities will be focused on clinical, operational, and administrative considerations for a unique delivery model while ensuring a seamless customer experience.
  • Developing and leading speaker bureau strategy, training, and program logistics
  • Maintaining a digital ecosystem for peer-to-peer programming, including non-personal tactics such as KOL videos and other assets for on-demand consumption.
  • Optimizing the metrics strategy for all medical education activities
  • The Product Director must work closely with multiple functions including Sales, Sales Learning & Development, Commercial Insights & Strategy, Medical Affairs, Global Strategic Marketing, Communications, Regulatory, Health Care Compliance (HCC), Innovative Medicine affiliates, outside vendors and Key Opinion Leader speakers to effectively implement key commercial activities.

This is not an extensive, comprehensive listing of job functions (may perform other duties as assigned). The ideal candidate will have significant in-line brand strategy and tactical execution experience demonstrating a track record of success including operating with a big picture orientation and attention to detail. This candidate must effectively manage multiple agencies and internal partners, communicate clearly and concisely, deliver all projects within budget, assess project impact on driving sales, and work both independently and in collaboration with team to achieve organization and brand goals.

Qualifications

Qualifications

  • B.A. or a B.S. degree is required and an MBA or an advanced degree is helpful but not required.
  • A minimum of 5 years of relevant experience is required including a minimum of 2 years marketing.
  • Sales or sales leadership experience is preferred.
  • Medical Education experience preferred.
  • Ability to be creative, enthusiastic, and strong analytically, with excellent overall business insight, and demonstrated ability to think strategically is fundamental.
  • Demonstrate excellent leadership and communication skills with a heightened ability to collaborate and work with a team in a matrixed environment to be successful.
  • Experience managing multiple demands and priorities on time, leading teams, gaining alignment, and driving decision-making is essential to the success of this position.
  • Interpersonal flexibility to effectively interact with a broad range of personnel, advanced communication, presentation, and facilitation skills are required.

This position may require up to 30% domestic and/or international travel.

The base pay range for this position is $118K to $177K. The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis. Job Title: Sr. Director, Global Strategic Marketing – Developed Eye Stronghold
Job Description:
Description

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

Johnson & Johnson MedTech, Vision a member of Johnson & Johnson’s Family of Companies is recruiting for a Sr. Director, Global Strategic Marketing – Developed Eye Stronghold to be located in Jacksonville, FL.

Drawing on a century of working alongside clinicians, we are focused on solving the world’s most pressing healthcare challenges through innovation at the intersection of biology and technology.

Always beginning with the unmet needs of patients, we break through barriers to develop and deliver medical technologies that help save lives, change the course of disease, and restore health. Our innovations enable clinicians to reach the hardest-to-reach parts of the body, treat with pinpoint precision, restore anatomy, and reimagine healing and recovery.

Together, we will continue to develop smarter, less invasive, more personalized solutions to tackle the leading causes of mortality and the most complex diseases around the world.

Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for our MedTech and innovative health products. Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees, and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

The Sr. Director, GSM Developed Eye Stronghold will lead the strategy, innovation an d marketing agenda for the Developed Eye Stronghold which includes the $3.5 billion dollar ACUVUE® brand. This leader will create value via their partnership with markets, regions, R&D, Business Development, Global Business Insights, Finance and Supply Chain and have direct line management for the Developed Eye marketing team.

This role will provide leadership in marketing, brand strategy, pricing, market development, key opinion leader (KOL) engagement, sales, professional education, and competitive insights, innovation and business development. They will be responsible for:

  • Shaping the strategy for the Developed Eye portfolio
  • Shaping the marketing agenda for the portfolio, inclusive of brand positioning, architecture, and pricing guidance
  • Shaping the innovation and pipeline strategy for the Developed Eye Stronghold in collaboration with cross-functional partners
  • Developing global insights to drive new product concepts, market segmentation, KOL engagement and marketing strategies.
  • Managing the New Product Innovation pipeline, including meeting key development milestones
  • Working closely with the regional marketing teams to execute marketing and launch plans
  • Partnering closely with the regions to understand market dynamics and support the regional commercial needs
  • Creating relationships with worldwide key opinion leaders
  • Driving value-based healthcare initiatives through key claims and a robust evidence strategy
  • Managing portfolio profitability and the global P&L
  • Building a pipeline of talent and fostering a culture of engagement within the team.
  • Other duties as required

Qualifications

  • Minimum of a bachelor’s degree is required. MBA is preferred.
  • Significant track record of success (10+ years) of related experience required.
  • Experience in Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) Marketing is required.
  • Achieving results in Sales and Marketing through leadership experience is required.
  • Experience in MedTech industry is preferred.
  • Ability to challenge the status quo and lead change is required.
  • Ability to forge internal collaboration across all levels of the enterprise is required
  • Demonstrated ability in business strategy and financial management is required.
  • Strong influencing skills with internal and external partners is required.
  • Proven leadership ability to motivate and lead cross-functional teams across a matrix organization is required
  • 30% travel required

Job Title: Advanced Analytics, Engagement Manager - Oncology
Job Description:
Description

Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine is searching for an Advanced Analytics - Engagement Manager to support the Oncology commercial organization based in Horsham, PA.

At J&J Innovative Medicine what matters most is helping people live full and healthy lives! We focus on treating, curing and preventing some of the most devastating and complex diseases of our time. And we pursue the most promising science, wherever it might be found.

Please visit https://www.janssen.com/johnson-johnson-innovative-medicine for more information.

The Engagement Manager works collaboratively with other commercial teams to translate business needs into innovative advanced analytics solutions. The Engagement Manager will influence decision-making at senior levels, uncover opportunities to drive revenue, grow share and improve our commercial model.

Key Responsibilities :

  • Co-locate with marketing, sales, and commercial analytics teams to understand brand priorities, uncover unmet needs, and pro-actively find opportunities for further innovation
  • Be a change management advocate and drive new thinking with regard to role of analytics within the organization
  • Build scalable analytics solutions in partnership with Data Engineering and Data Science teams that align with and further brand strategy
  • Craft analytics deliverables that are clear, concise, and consumable by marketing and sales leadership
  • Determine the impact of solutions & programs through leading and lagging indicators including conducting A/B testing
  • Prioritize and coordinate AI product enhancements across team of contractors and internal partners to ensure efficient operations and continuous product improvement
  • Manage day-to-day relationships and projects with sales leadership, brand teams and other commercial stakeholders across commercial excellence
  • Assist in budget management, project prioritization, and project management
  • Build, evolve and manage promotional response models to provide insights and recommendations to optimize promotional efforts
  • Strategically advise optimal investment to improve returns across different promotional channels and teams based on program impact (e.g. return-on-investment)

Qualifications

Experience and Skills:

  • Intellectual curiosity and commitment to learning new things!
  • Proficient understanding of machine learning techniques (e.g., supervised, unsupervised, deep learning) and their real-world advantages and drawbacks is required
  • Excellent communication skills and comfort influencing decision-making at all levels of the organization is required
  • Proficient understanding of pharmaceutical sales and marketing is preferred
  • Solid understanding of pharmaceutical open and closed claims data sources (e.g. IQVIA, Symphony Health, Truven, Optum, Komodo) is preferred with experience conducting patient analytics across funnel (demand generation, fulfillment, persistency) is preferred
  • Skilled in data extraction and summarization from large datasets using SQL and basic statistical analysis using preferred languages (i.e. Python, SQL, R) is preferred
  • A minimum of 5 years of relevant business experience in marketing, finance, analytics, management consulting or related field is required
  • A minimum of a Bachelor Degree is required

Other:

This position is based in Horsham, PA and will require up to 15% domestic travel

The anticipated base pay range for this position is $113K to $170K USD.

At Johnson and Johnson we reward results in competitive ways! This includes a rewarding patient first career, health and wellness benefits, paid time off, and 401(k) retirement savings with a generous company match. This role is also eligible for a competitive bonus that is based off employee’s performance.

Job Description:
Description

Abiomed, Inc. part of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, is recruiting for a Part-Time Clinical Consultant located in Newark.

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/ .

The Part-Time Clinical Consultant (PTCC) role is an exciting opportunity to join Abiomed, one of the industry's fast-growing medical device companies. This role is the first step for Nurses, Advanced Practice Providers, and Cardiology or Radiology Techs to join our world-class field organization. This part-time position will be responsible for providing case support, patient management, and education to both new and existing accounts within an assigned Franchise/Region.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Acquire and demonstrate a working knowledge of our products/therapies and develop an understanding of their applications.
  • Improve patient outcomes by delivering Impella® education in a variety of settings, including but not limited to, the ICU, OR, and Cath Lab.
  • Impella® case support, including on-call support.
  • Completing proactive rounds for patients receiving support and assistance.
  • Collaborate with the Clinical Support Center (CSC) for ongoing additional support as necessary.
  • Maintain clinical competency in current product line, patient management, and remain up to date on most relevant information through continual learning and education.
  • Some travel may be needed.

Qualifications

  • Clinical certification is required; a Registered Nurse (RN)/Advanced Practice Provider (APP) license is strongly preferred.
  • 3+ years’ experience with a strong clinical background in the Cardiac ICU (CICU), Cardiovascular ICU (CVICU), Cardiovascular OR (CVOR), or Catheterization Lab (Cath Lab) required. CVICU experience is highly preferred.
  • Some industry experience is preferred, but not required.
  • Significant experience with Impella® is required (minimum of 10 cases/patients supported).
  • Must provide a minimum of (2) days of live support within the field (case support, patient rounding, providing education), with a total of (5) days of availability per month.
  • Availability must include (1) weekend per month.
  • Ability to work on weekends, nights, holidays as well as weekdays.
  • Ability to work at other hospitals aside from base location.

The hourly rate for this role is $60/hr.

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career, and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com .

Job Title: Product Director (Senior Manager), Customer Care Operations, GU
Job Description:
Description

Johnson & Johnson, is currently recruiting for a Product Director, Customer Care Operations, GU located in Horsham, PA.

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/ .

The Product Director, Customer Care Operations, GU will develop and execute clinical and operational bladder and prostate cancer market development initiatives to expand practice care capabilities to better deliver current treatments and adopt novel therapies. In this role, you will be responsible for generating insights, shaping, and implementing clinical and operational market development initiatives.  This Product Director will work across multiple functions and teams, including brand marketing, field sales, and other internal partners to help execute our key business initiatives for bladder and prostate cancers.

Position Description:

  • Leads development of comprehensive marketing plans, including strategy, positioning, and messaging, to achieve business goals
  • Ensures market development clinical and operational strategies, marketing assets and tactical plans are developed and performed in close partnership with marketing brand team, Global Commercial Strategy Organization, Sales, Sales Learning & Development, Medical Affairs, and key internal partners
  • Leverage quantitative and qualitative insights to develop realistic yet ambitious prostate and bladder brand-aligned care delivery strategies to drive portfolio growth
  • Create customer-facing resources to effectively position J&J capabilities and prostate and bladder cancer portfolios with population health decision makers to drive action
  • Develop market development and operational content with learning and development team for sales meetings and ongoing field development to support brand strategies
  • Lead advisory boards, analytics, and market research to generate clinical and operational care insights for marketing initiatives in partnership with the insights and analytics team

Qualifications

Requirements:

  • A minimum Bachelor’s degree is required; MBA or advanced degree in related field is helpful.
  • A minimum of 7 years of relevant business experience, including pharmaceutical and healthcare knowledge
  • A minimum 5 years' experience in Sales, Marketing, Managed Care Account Management, Pricing and/or related fields
  • Proven proficiencies in marketing, project management, and clear communication.
  • Ability to travel up to 20%, which may include overnight and weekend travel.

Preferred:

  • People leadership experience
  • Experience in oncology and urology
  • Experience in clinical and operational care models and market development
  • Experience working in matrix environment
  • Experience with product launch preferred

Job Title: Associate Director, Scientific Patient Engagement Research
Job Description:
Description

Johnson and Johnson is recruiting an Associate Director, Scientific Patient Engagement Research, to be located in Titusville, NJ.

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

The Scientific Patient Engagement Research Associate Director is responsible for leading and driving high priority patient-focused activities from early strategy development through planning, execution, and dissemination. This role is critical for effectively partnering internally in Janssen to develop and implement innovative patient-centered research opportunities. Responsibilities will include crafting and running patient engagement activities, including Patient Engagement Research Councils (PERCs), direct-to-patient research activities and other activities.

This role will drive and support strategy, execution, and actioning of patient engagement research activities for Medical and Scientific Affairs’ therapeutic areas to ensure an end-to-end patient voice strategy. Strong research, project management and organization skills are essential for success in this role that works with colleagues in Scientific Affairs, Medical Affairs, Commercial, R&D, HCC, legal, privacy, contracting and others.

This role will collaborate with vendor(s) to drive project progress and use scientific and research expertise and problem-solving skills to ensure all studies and engagements are successful. Furthermore, the Scientific Patient Engagement Research Associate Director will help to develop communications to share findings and standard methodologies in the organization and support the introduction of new patient-focused research generation capabilities to support and grow the broader North America Pharmaceuticals Patient Engagement strategy, capability building and implementation efforts. This associate will also act as a company spokesperson regarding dissemination and utilization of patient-focused research findings.

Qualifications

  • A minimum of a  Master’s degree in Public Health, Health Services Research, Economics, Epidemiology, Pharmacy, Health Policy, or a related discipline is required; a Doctorate or other Advanced degree is preferred.
  • A minimum of 4 to 6 or more years of relevant work experience required with a strong medical or scientific background is preferred.
  • Experience engaging with patients and conducting real world evidence research applying patient-reported outcomes, retrospective data analyses, epidemiology or health services research with patient-focus is required.
  • Experience in the healthcare industry is required.
  • Clinical knowledge or practice across multiple therapeutic areas is preferred
  • Experience collaborating with advocacy groups and/or patients preferred.
  • Independent high- level planning and execution of research strategies is required.
  • Firm understanding of drug development process and regulatory standards for approval and communication of data including regulatory and healthcare compliance guidelines/policies Is required.
  • Firm understanding of United States health care systems and customers; specifically understanding unique business models and perspectives is preferred.
  • Firm understanding of the uses of evidence-based medicine and comparative effectiveness analyses for health policy decision-making is required.
  • Excellent collaboration, influencing and communication (both written and presentation) skills.
  • Advanced knowledge of Word, PowerPoint and Excel required.
  • 20% Travel required mostly national with occasional international travel.

Competencies:

  • Demonstrates innovative / creative approaches to identify and assess new research methodologies and opportunities to develop outcomes research projects.
  • Flexible self-starter with excellent networking and team building capabilities and cross-functional team leadership required.
  • Ability to balance multiple and sophisticated projects and tasks
  • Demonstration of proficiencies for creativity, problem-solving, and innovative solutions required.
  • Behaves with honesty and integrity and in the spirit of J&J’s Credo
  • Attains business results / goals and objectives
  • Creates value for customers
  • Thinks strategically in project implementation
  • Builds interdependent partnering
  • Implements positive change

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

The anticipated base pay range for this position is: $135,000 - $232,300.

  • The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs.  Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan.  The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year.  Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis.
  • Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance.
  • Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company’s consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)).
  • Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits:
    • Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar year
    • Sick time - up to 40 hours per calendar year
    • Holiday pay, including Floating Holidays – up to 13 days per calendar year
    • Work, Personal and Family Time - up to 40 hours per calendar year

For additional general information on company benefits, please go to: https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits

Job Title: Associate Director, Translational Clinical Medical Lead Translational Science & Medicine- Immunology
Job Description:
Description

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/ .

Johnson & Johnson is recruiting for an Associate Director, Translational Clinical Medical Lead (TCML), Immunology Translational Sciences and Medicine (TSM) to be located in Spring House, PA.

The primary focus of this Associate Director, Translational Clinical Medical Lead (TCML) position within the Clinical Science Group within the Immunology Translational Science and Medicine (TSM) department is to lead the safety strategy; develop the medical review and oversight plans and conduct medical surveillance and interpretation of safety findings for clinical pharmacology (CPP) and Early Development (ED) studies as outlined in the asset clinical development plan (CDP).

For TSM Accountable studies the TCML will lead and be the responsible for study planning, execution and communication to TSM leadership, Asset Lead and CDT (compound development team) as needed.  The TCML will partner with the CPP lead on CPP owned study design, protocol development and execution, being accountable for the medical monitoring and safety strategy of these trials.

This work is at its core a deep collaboration between Disease Area experts, CPP, Clinical and Non-Clinical Safety, Translational Science (Biomarker), Translational Medicine (Clinical) experts, Immunologic Pathway experts and other relevant stakeholders at the CDT. The TCML collaborates with Global Development Operations (GDO) and the entire Trial Team to operationalize studies efficiently and effectively.

PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Functions as the clinical lead with MM role responsibilities on clinical pharmacology and other ED studies, as needed.
  • Serves as Global study responsible physician (SRP) and maintains oversight for ethnic bridging studies in partnership with the local teams.
  • Manages actions to be taken during a study as they relate to subject eligibility and safety.
  • Identifies and assesses medical risks and mitigation plans prior to and during clinical trials.
  • Follows Janssen SOPs for the SRP function including development of medical review plans; medical input and development of protocol elements document (PEDs), protocols, Informed Consent Form (ICF), Case Report Forms (CRF), Top Line Results (TLRs), Clinical Study Reports (CSRs); owner of safety sections of key documents (DSURs, CSRs, briefing books, etc.)
  • Evaluates safety in support of dose escalation safety data reviews and decision making.
  • Interacts with regulatory authorities and external stakeholders (study Investigators/ /Vendors)
  • May participate on early development CDTs to contribute to and communicate strategic asset information relevant to the study design and at key meetings (e.g., CDT, Protocol Review Committee (PRC), First in Humans Early Development Committee (FIHEDC)

STUDY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Addresses questions and comments on protocol design at Protocol Review Committee meetings (PRC).
  • Ensures study conduct adheres to Good Clinical Practices, International Conference of Harmony (ICH) guidelines, and Janssen standard operating procedures.
  • Regularly surveils/assesses safety in ongoing clinical studies (e.g., prepare and archive medical monitoring reports)
  • Communicates SUSAR case digests with GMS and/or other SRPs.
  • Performs routine (e.g., biweekly or monthly) AE and CM coding reviews.
  • Reviews SAE/severe AE case studies with principal investigators as necessary.
  • Responsible as an owner of safety sections of key documents such as CSRs.
  • Presents trial design, trial conduct updates, and top line results for assigned studies to management.

In collaboration with other functions in GDO:

  • Participates in study feasibility, CRO/site selection, trial preparation, initiation, conduct, monitoring, and database locks.
  • May review the scope of work for vendor contracts (e.g., medical monitoring), for accuracy of work outputs.
  • May lead the MM outsourcing strategy (e.g. vendor selection, definition of scope of work, contracting and budget).
  • Reviews incoming data from the study for accuracy and completeness; responsible for data review in conjunction with other clinical team members prior to database locks (iDARTS/Spotfire, listings etc.)
  • Supports the assessment and review of clinical safety data from studies by collecting and summarizing appropriate safety data/information for review by the Molecule Responsible Physician (MRP) and/or Safety Management Team (SMT).
  • Reviews and interprets clinical trial data to enable timely internal decision-making and external communication with investigators and regulatory agencies.
  • Contributes to the safety sections of the clinical study report and assures the overall integrity of the data presented in the CSR.
  • Contributes to updates of the IB (Investigator Brochure) and regulatory documents (e.g., Briefing books, scientific advice meetings, DSURs).
  • Reports the status of clinical trials to management.

Qualifications

  • Physician (MD or equivalent required).
  • 3 years or more of clinical experience. Relevant work experience as Medical Monitor, and/or pharmacovigilance and/or drug safety officer in a CRO, pharma/biotech.  Early Clinical Development and Clinical Pharmacology experience is preferred.
  • Knowledge of global regulatory requirements, ICH, GCP and clinical trial terminology is required.
  • Ability to survey and interpret scientific literature related to assigned projects is required.
  • Excellent written and verbal English communication and presentation skills is preferred.
  • Working knowledge of the use of Microsoft suite of software products including Excel, PowerPoint, and Word. Ability to do more complex data analysis with Excel or similar programs is a plus.
  • Leadership and interpersonal skills. The ability to advise, persuade, and negotiate with colleagues in a supportive and encouraging fashion is highly preferred.
  • Good sense of cultural sensitivity and diversity.
  • Project and time management skills are required.
  • Strong organizational skills and the ability to work well in a dynamic environment and be able to prioritize and respond to changing needs of the business is a plus.
  • The ability to work in a matrix organization with (virtual) cross-functional teams is required.
  • Ability to operate independently or with limited day to day supervision is required.
  • Ability to work under pressure to meet deadlines.
  • Ability to handle complex projects and to overcome delays and obstacles is highly preferred.
  • Willingness and ability to travel, including trans-Atlantic travel if applicable.

Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies are equal opportunity employers, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
