Job Title: Acquisitions & Divestitures (A&D) Deal Program Manager (1 of 2)
Job Description:
Description

Johnson & Johnson is recruiting Acquisitions & Divestitures (A&D) Deal Program Manager to be located in New Brunswick, NJ.

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe good health is the foundation of vibrant lives, thriving communities and forward progress. That’s why for more than 135 years, we have aimed to keep people well at every age and every stage of life. Today, as the world’s largest and most broadly based healthcare company, we are committed to using our reach and size for good. We strive to improve access and affordability, create healthier communities, and put a healthy mind, body and environment within reach of everyone, everywhere.

Every day, our more than 140,000 employees across the world are blending heart, science and ingenuity to profoundly change the trajectory of health for humanity.

This position reports to the A&D Senior Director Portfolio and Program Management. The position will manage, coordinate and complete Acquisitions & Divestitures programs for Johnson and Johnson Technology. In this capacity, the Deal Program Manager will partner with Regional Program managers and Deal Leads to plan and execute A&D projects. The Deal Program Manager will build strategies and define scope, identify and handle multi-functional interdependencies, identify and coordinate the creation of vital program documentation to ensure alignment; develop overall program plan, lead all aspects of successful execution, and track program status and provide updates to the Deal Lead, Global PMO, senior leadership and partners. Supervise detailed plans for A&D activities across the JJT organization to ensure smooth transitions. The role will partner and collaborate with enterprise IT groups and other business functions (IT, HR, Finance, Facilities, etc.) to identify and address interdependencies between the teams, to ensure workstreams deliver per plan and proactively identify and engage JJT and business partners.

Throughout key programs, the incumbent will be responsible for analyzing, planning and handling the program budget and engaging resources.

The role requires active engagement with a variety of organizations within Johnson and Johnson including IT, Commercial, R&D, Supply Chain and Corporate groups to drive successful A&D programs.

Strong interdependent partnering and communication skills are required for the Deal Program Manager to collaborate with many partners outside and within J&J. This position will be expected to run multiple strategic A&D programs concurrently and share updates to senior leadership. The candidate will require a deep understanding of Acquisition and Divestitures, J&J structure, strong execution and delivery skills, and a bias toward problem solving and resolution.

Key Responsibilities:

  • For assigned A&D program, define the JJT transition strategy based on the deal type and interdependencies and impact on other workstreams. Collect and consolidate all program plans
  • Closely partner with and coach the assigned Project Managers to track and monitor the projects within the program, identify interdependencies, issues/risks and potential mitigations, resources, and lessons learned. Assist deal lead with priorities, issues and escalations
  • Provides access to program progress to JJT and business leadership; provides updates to partners as appropriate; be the single source of truth for program status
  • Assist in preparing, reviewing and presenting change requests, funding/resource needs or issues requiring decisions from global or regional governance.
  • Handle program financials including contingency funds for change requests
  • Lead change management & communications efforts related to the A&D activities with appropriate partners.
  • Assist in the creation and oversight of all Transition Service Agreements (TSAs) and ensure regional considerations are included
  • Collaborate with the Buyer or Seller to ensure there is alignment to successfully meet the TSA exit dates
  • Develop short-term/long-term IT strategies to improve A&D execution
  • Use and improve portions of JJT A&D playbook and other tools to deliver deals more holistically. Ensure playbook consistency and use of recommended standard methodologies.

Qualifications

Required:

  • A minimum of Bachelor’s Degree
  • 5+ years of A&D experience in leading large complex programs.
  • At least 3 years of IT experience with business acquisitions or divestitures and integration activities
  • Strong proficiency with project management practices, tools and methodologies including financial management
  • Strong data analytical skills with experience with Excel modeling, Smartsheet, PowerBI/Tableau reporting
  • Strong leadership, communication and interpersonal skills. Effective collaborator and problem solver.
  • Experience / knowledge of cultures across the globe with an Executive presence
  • Ability to work under stress and strict timelines. Ability to set-up and facilitate multi-functional meeting to resolve issues in a timely manner
  • Models Credo Values – demonstrates strong values, ethics and communication skills that establish a culture of trust and transparency. Build partnering solutions across business and IT
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills (oral and written) including the ability to explain technology concepts to business partners
  • Demonstrable ability to assemble, prioritize and present large amount of data and publish them concisely, so they are understandable and impactful
  • Multi-function experience; understands business processes, end to end business processes impact on project dependencies.

Preferred:

  • PMP (Project Management Professional) designation
  • 3-5 years of relevant A&D experience with either a management consulting firm, a top-tier tech company, a private equity firm, or an investment bank

Other:

  • 20% business travel expected
  • Work location onsite : New Jersey - New Brunswick

The anticipated base pay range for this position is $99,000- $170,200

Job Title: Group Product Director, Patient Marketing, DARZALEX
Job Description:
Description

Johnson & Johnson is recruiting for a Group Product Director, Patient Marketing, DARZALEX® located in Horsham, PA.

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/ .

The Group Product Director (GPD) will lead all aspects of Patient and Nurse Strategy and Execution for DARZALEX®.  This individual will be responsible for leading a team of marketers focused on the patient, caregiver, and patient care team audiences.  This person will be accountable for meeting key strategic objectives of the brand, and contributing to revenue performance in the U.S.

Responsibilities

The GPD will be directly responsible for developing the patient experience strategy across the DARZALEX® patient journey, where the patient care team members are a critical stakeholder.  The GPD will also lead the execution of that strategy through an innovative, insights-based approach to engaging patients and their care team to start and stay on the DARZALEX®. This includes, ensuring awareness through direct to patient (DTP) advertising, building advocacy relations, and providing education to patients and their care team.

This individual will also be responsible for partnering with the GPD Market Access and the Patient Engagement and Customer Solutions (PECS) team to ensure optimal access and financial support for the brand patients while also demonstrating leadership & partnership across the Multiple Myeloma portfolio.

Additional responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following:

  • Develop and oversee execution of direct to patient (DTP) strategy through creation of the first “direct to patient” precision marketing plan in Oncology; integrating insights, campaign and message development, asset creation (branded and unbranded) and media planning to optimize omnichannel performance with the goal of meeting patient needs in a timely and relevant way
  • Own strategy and execution of leveraging Advanced Practice Providers (APPs) as a key influencer of brand choice and decision to continue on treatment while optimizing  total patient experience
  • Manage agency of record and other specialty agencies
  • Liaise with the Oncology Clinical Educator Leadership Team to define & execute brand priorities along with performance tracking
  • Align with Advocacy team to implement advocacy strategy and integrate across HCP and Payer teams to maximize value of those partnerships
  • Collaborate with PR/Communications team on external communications initiatives and signature campaigns related to patients, advanced practice providers and nurses
  • Partner across brand GPDs and key PECS & SCG partners to address affordability and patient access pain points and develop prioritized solutions to optimize the patient experience
  • Manage Patient Experience budget, including team budget management
  • Oversee tactical execution of direct reports; Create culture of experimentation, provide coaching, development, and day-to-day management of direct reports

This individual must demonstrate strong leadership presence through influencing without authority with high-level management, detail orientation, and excellent strategic thinking. This position requires extensive interactions with multiple stakeholders.

Qualifications

  • A minimum of a Bachelor's degree is required. Postgraduate qualification, PhD, MBA, or other graduate degree is preferred.
  • A minimum of 8 years of business experience with a minimum of 5 years demonstrated in-line marketing, sales or sales management/training experience executing marketing strategy is required.
  • A demonstrated ability to partner and work with multiple agencies/vendors, manage budgets and projects, cross-functionally, and with cross-company teams of high-level managers and executives is required.
  • A demonstrated ability to manage multiple demands and priorities on time, lead teams, gain alignment and driving decision making is required.
  • Demonstrated ability to formally manage, coach, and develop direct reports is strongly preferred.
  • Prior experience in patient/consumer marketing and oncology is preferred.
  • Strong verbal, written and executive communication skills are required along with demonstrated presentation skills.
  • Senior brand responsibility, people management, product launch, and a solid understanding of pharmaceutical development is preferred.
  • This position is in Horsham, PA and requires up to 25% travel.

Job Title: Technology Services - Senior Manager, SAP Finance
Job Description:
Description

Johnson & Johnson is recruiting for a Technology Services - Senior Manager, SAP Finance who is passionate about developing sophisticated solutions and providing technical and process expertise to support Finance requirements. The position is to be located in Raritan, NJ. Remote work options may be considered on a case-by-case basis and if approved by the Company.

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

Job Description Details:

Technology Services Senior Manager Finance will partner with the finance and corporate organizations to build, enhance, and support SAP applications. He/She will be responsible for the design and delivery of SAP Finance projects and integration with other systems which requires the use of specialized technical & functional knowledge.

Primary responsibilities include Design and Deployment of SAP Finance projects, lead and support Invoice to Cash flows, and provide escalation support on SAP Finance and the integration of the platforms with corporate SAP and non-SAP systems. This role requires a combination of finance business process and technology expertise. As Senior Manager, you will collaborate with Business Unit IT partners to lead upstream/downstream system impact and interfaces.

Duties & Responsibilities:

Technology Services Senior Manager Finance will:

·        Leads Design and Delivery of SAP Finance including Invoice to Cash solutions. This role requires a broad in-depth knowledge of Finance business processes, Invoice to Cash, FSCM module, and integration with SAP and Non-SAP Systems.

·       Responsible for reviewing user stories, user story functional document specifications, review technical specifications and coordinate required development activities. Leads to create or modify system specifications or test scripts to complete project implementation.

·       The incumbent will be responsible to configure SAP system with the functionality defined in the business requirements and participate in integration and user acceptance testing of RICEF’s.

·       Leads the assessment of the technical feasibility of proposed solutions and provides appropriate recommendations based on industry trends and existing design.

·       Manage the budget for the delivery of the service and be responsible for reporting on service performance to leadership and customers.

·       Captures customer insights to improve SAP projects throughout design & delivery and delivers continuous improvement recommendations to service owners. Conduct impact analysis on process/tools coming from new/enhanced services.

·       Assists in knowledge transfer to team members and organizations after successful delivery of the service.

·       Performs assessments of customer demand and partners with order analysts to deliver estimates and quotes for SAP Finance design and delivery service(s) to the customer

·       Plan, select, and schedule approved vendors to deliver the service. Oversee the work of vendor resources throughout a project. Provide guidance and expertise to team members in executing the projects/enhancements.

·       Develop service improvement plans and/or run service improvement initiatives

·       Applies compliance requirements within scope of responsibility, provides documentation as necessary, and participates in compliance activities as required.

Qualifications

Required:

·         A minimum of a bachelor’s degree required, preferably in Information Technology or equivalent

·         A minimum of 10 years of Information Technology experience

·         A minimum of 7 years of SAP experience within Finance, Invoice to Cash and FSCM.

·         Advanced knowledge and proficiency in SAP FSCM and Invoice to Cash process.

·         S4 HANA SAP Finance knowledge and experience

·         A demonstrated understanding of financial business processes

·         Problem solving and process improvement skills

·         The ability to partner with, influence and effectively communicate with all levels of the organization, including senior management

·         The ability to lead a team of professionals and external consultants

Preferred:

·         Advanced understanding of J&J I/T's technology standards and strategies

·         Experience supporting businesses within Pharma, Medical industry is highly desirable

·         Experience working in Gxp environment

·         Cross functional experience and experience with integration with MM, SD, PP modules

·         Individual must be proficient in creating defects and test scripts using QTest or JIRA.

·         Standout colleague with good communication skills and be customer oriented, aiming at effective collaboration with internal and external partners.

·         Experience effectively collaborating and handling partners.

·         Strong problem-solving skills with ability of accurately analyze situations and reach productive decisions based on informed judgment.

Other:

Approximately 5 % of local, domestic and international travel may be required for this position.

The anticipated base pay range for this position is $118,000- $203,550.

·         The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis.

·         Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance.

·         Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company’s consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)).

·         Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits:

o   Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar year

o   Sick time - up to 40 hours per calendar year; for employees who reside in the State of Washington – up to 56 hours per calendar year

o   Holiday pay, including Floating Holidays – up to 13 days per calendar year

o   Work, Personal and Family Time - up to 40 hours per calendar year

Job Title: WMS Technical Product Owner
Job Description:
Description

Johnson & Johnson Health Care Systems Inc., a member of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is currently recruiting a Distribution Technical Product Owner, Americas. The position will be based in Mooresville, Indiana.

Johnson & Johnson Health Care Systems Inc. provides account management and customer support services to key health care customers, including hospital systems and group purchasing organizations, leading health plans, pharmacy benefit Leads, and government health care institutions. The company also provides contract management, logistics and supply chain functions for the major Johnson & Johnson franchises.

Accountable for the business relationship management of the Deliver organization, supporting the Tier 1 Distribution Centers. Own vision and prioritization of new features and/or enhancements to a product / platform (or scope of the product addressed by the squad) and help translate business needs into prioritized user stories, accountable for value delivery and value realization at the squad level.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Shape the vision / roadmap for and steer the squad in delivering products / platforms features / work oriented around business impact within the deliver organization.
  • Shape backlog, applying business expertise and voice of the customer, translate requirements & add acceptance criteria.
  • Approve all documentation related to the product.
  • Balance business value with technical feasibility while prioritizing requirements and features, optimizing cost, and improving delivery efficiency.
  • Plan resourcing for the squad (i.e. new role, change in role), create Technology Services Engage requests, interview, select and onboard members to join the squad.
  • Accountable for defining and hitting squad Objectives and Key Results.
  • Work closely with business partners to establish the products’ business value and support messaging, communications, and customer outreach.
  • Drive continuous improvement across the product lifecycle.
  • Interact with other Squads within the Product / Platform as part of synchronization ceremonies to implement cross-squad tasks.
  • Collaborate to ensure all partners are clear on product roadmap activities, design, interdependencies, and timelines.
  • Actively participate in all squad ceremonies; leads and optimizes the flow of value using various tools and reporting cadence.
  • Lead issue resolution with Network and business partners for Blue Yonder and SAP eWM Warehouse Management Systems.
  • Support resolution of issues with WCS, Infrastructure, external suppliers, and business for WMS application/s.
  • Partner with Distribution Systems Technology and Technical Services (Engineering) to scope, define, and implement changes and projects.
  • Work with Security Risk Management, Infrastructure, and DC Operations teams on cyber risk remediation.
  • Work with vendor management team/s for SOWs and POs.

Qualifications

Education:

  • A minimum of a bachelor’s degree required.

Experience and Skills:

  • 8-10 years of Supply Chain, Supply Chain IT and/or relevant business experience within healthcare.
  • Proficiency in end-to-end supply chain processes with strong business insight into Distribution/Logistics and Warehouse Management Systems is required.
  • Experience as Blue Yonder WMS techno-functional is a must. Need to have done at least two Blue Yonder warehouse implementations.
  • WCS (Exacta) and WES are required. Other warehouse control systems such as Dematic, BOSS, and RFID, conveyors, and VLM’s are an asset.
  • Knowledge of S/4 HANA nice to have but not required.
  • Data driven. Identify and bring forward AI/ML opportunities in a real-time DC Ops environment.
  • New way to designing solutions.
  • Proficiency in SDLC methodologies including waterfall, agile and Scaled Agile.
  • Strong leadership, communication, and social skills.
  • Proven leadership, influencing and people development skills.
  • Demonstrated technical proficiency in supply chain technologies/systems.
  • A solid understanding of the business imperatives and issues facing all teams with the company and/or corporate landscape.
  • Ability to communicate the complexities in a clear, concise, and compelling way.
  • A high tolerance for ambiguity is required and effective management skills.
  • Experience gathering requirements and translating into a product vision by tapping into their expertise in product development, engineering, and UX.
  • Deep understanding of business/processes and high-level understanding of high-quality digital product delivery.
  • Experienced in leading a product backlog/release plan, tracking team level metrics, attend product team ceremonies, removing blockers (burndown chart, release burn up).
  • Experienced in developing systems and tools to enable customer interactions and collaboration (e.g., digital self, precision marketing, DAM, immersive technology).
  • Understanding of customer journeys and customer experience.
  • Foundational skills (at minimum) in Data Engineering, Cybersecurity, Intelligent Automation and Emerging Technology.
  • Creates a culture that relentlessly focuses on helping the people and organizations we touch.
  • Commitment to Our Credo, Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (who we are and what we believe) by ensuring we are attracting, developing, and retaining talent that reflects the communities we serve.
  • Demonstrated success in leading cross-functional self-organized teams.
  • Supplies ideas that challenge thinking.
  • Strong problem-solving skills with ability of accurately analyze situations and reach productive decisions based on informed judgment.

Job Title: Facility Manager, CAR-T
Job Description:
Description

Johnson & Johnson is currently seeking a Facility Manager for our Janssen Pharmaceuticals, Inc. team!

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

As a Facility Manager you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the world by contributing to the development of innovative healthcare solutions. Join our team and be part of a company that believes health is everything!

Position Summary:

You will play a critical role in driving Facilities Management within our 24/7/365 CAR-T manufacturing operation. You will be responsible for ensuring a quality, safe, compliant, and productive workplace environment.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Serve as the primary point of contact for Facilities quality, safety, compliance, and performance, ensuring a high level of customer service.
  • Manage and coordinate vendor relationships, including contract details, performance evaluations, and ongoing communication.
  • Coordinate and manage facility shutdowns, ensuring minimal disruption to operations by effectively scheduling, allocating resources, and mitigating risks.
  • Address day-to-day operational needs promptly, resolving issues to maintain continuity and efficiency.
  • Develop and implement strategies for operational excellence, cost reduction, and facility optimization.
  • Interact with site and corporate leaders to represent Facilities and provide updates on facility-related matters.
  • Lead meetings with site occupants to communicate site services changes.
  • Recognize and communicate emerging site issues to ensure timely resolution.
  • Lead diverse teams through change and organizational transformation.
  • Support Project Development and Delivery teams on capital and infrastructure projects.
  • Serve as primary site liaison for Environmental Health & Safety compliance (as appropriate)

Qualifications

Education:

  • University/Bachelor's degree is required. Field of study in Engineering, Facilities Management, or Architecture is highly preferred.

Required:

  • Minimum of 8 years of relevant work experience
  • Knowledgeable in utility-based systems such as HVAC, chilled water, steam, compressed air, etc.
  • Strong skillset with HVAC systems, Building Controls and Monitoring systems
  • Use computer skills, demonstrating proficiency in MS Office Suite and CMMS
  • Strong communication skills, both written and oral, including the ability to present to small groups

Preferred:

  • Critical GMP/GLP regulated experience
  • Experience within healthcare / pharmaceutical environment
  • Demonstrated knowledge in technical and business areas
  • Budget/financial leadership skills
  • Documented success in achieving project goals
  • Strong record of local collaboration ensuring completion of projects and people development

Other:

  • Up to 10% domestic/international travel may be required

The anticipated base pay range for this position is $99,000 to $170,000.

The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan.  The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year.  Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis.

Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance.

Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company’s consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)).

This position is eligible to participate in the Company’s long-term incentive program.

Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits:

-          Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar year

-          Sick time - up to 40 hours per calendar year; for employees who reside in the State of Washington – up to 56 hours per calendar year

-          Holiday pay, including Floating Holidays – up to 13 days per calendar year

-          Work, Personal and Family Time - up to 40 hours per calendar year

For additional general information on Company benefits, please go to: - https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits

Job Title: Marketing Manager, Global Strategic Marketing
Job Description:
Description

Ethicon, a member of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, is currently recruiting for a Marketing Manager, Global Strategic Marketing leading the Open Stapling business. This open position will be based in Cincinnati, Ohio.

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/!

This individual will develop global strategies to grow the Open Stapling category. They will be responsible for portfolio and lifecycle management, new product innovation, and driving strategies and tactics for Open Stapling. This individual will be responsible for exploring new commercial business models and solutions to drive top-line revenue and for managing the health and profitability of the portfolio.

Key Responsibilities

  • Responsible for end-to-end brand strategy, including platform segmentation, messaging, positioning, pricing strategies, and regional launch execution.
  • Collaborate with regional partners to create and implement global strategies to drive continued above-market growth in Ethicon’s Open Stapling business.
  • Responsible for brand management, including portfolio optimization, profitability, and lifecycle management.
  • Partner with Value Stream, Lifecycle, and Supply Chain teams to initiate cost improvement projects and optimize the supply chain to improve efficiency and overall health of the platform.
  • Responsible for VOC and insights to inform pipeline strategy, including target product profile, claims, new product development, launch preparation, and execution of launch excellence.
  • Responsible for Open Stapling pipeline development, including external innovation and business development strategies, as required.
  • Partner with supply chain and demand planning to forecast growth accurately and secure appropriate capital investments to support the growth and long-term health of the brand.
  • Collaborate with the global specialty team to provide input and expertise to the overall Ethicon colorectal specialty strategy and build strong global network of key opinion leaders to drive growth and gather valuable customer insights.
  • The successful candidate will be responsible for reaching financial targets within specified budgets and timeframes.
  • Ensure applicable company compliance with all relevant country and regional requirements, company regulations, policies, and procedures.

Qualifications

  • A minimum of a bachelor’s degree is required.
  • An MBA or equivalent with a strong marketing, strategy, and finance background is preferred.
  • A minimum of 5 years of progressive business experience is required.
  • A minimum of 4 years of experience in healthcare marketing, sales, R&D, business development, professional or sales education, or related field is required.
  • Excellent cross-functional and management influencing skills are required.
  • The ability to develop customer relationships is required.
  • Demonstrated teamwork and influence management are required.
  • Previous medical device marketing, Global Strategic Marketing, and/or healthcare sales experience is highly preferred.
  • Experience in brand management and optimizing product profitability is preferred.
  • Experience in product lifecycle management is preferred.
  • Experience in product development, including needs assessment, new opportunity assessment, and prior product launch experience, is preferred.
  • Demonstrated experience developing and using customer insights is preferred.
  • Previous experience with Supply Chain and Demand Planning is preferred.
  • Knowledge of the customer, their procedures, and stapling devices is preferred.

The anticipated base pay range for this position is $99,000 - $170,200.

Job Title: Vice President, Marketing and Franchise Strategy, Neuroscience
Job Description:
Description

Johnson & Johnson is recruiting for a Vice President (VP), Marketing and Franchise Strategy, Neuroscience (NS), based in Titusville, NJ.

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything.  Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal.  Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity.  Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

Summary:

This role is responsible for sales, market share, and profit and loss (P&L) for a rapidly growing Neuroscience business as well as for leading the business strategy. The business includes our current Mood and Schizophrenia portfolio (key promoted brands include INVEGA SUSTENNA, INVEGA TRINZA, INVEGA HAFYERA, and SPRAVATO) and near-term new product pipeline. The leader will be responsible for Launch, Growth, and Mature lifecycle brand and execution strategies and plans for the portfolio. The VP must excel in working in a matrixed organizational environment as they will need to successfully manage and influence high level/complex internal and external partnerships, cross-company collaborations contributing to a critical multi-brand portfolio, multi-function partnerships, multi-billion dollar business unit sales and profitability, marketing and key account organization leadership responsibilities.

Marketing & Franchise responsibilities include:

  • Leadership of marketing strategies, plans and activities for the Mood and Schizophrenia business within Neuroscience, and the Franchise Strategy team. Leads Marketing organization for Schizophrenia and Mood and the Franchise team (which includes strategy, digital, channel, and the field-based Key Account Management organization)..
  • Co-lead the development and execution of global marketing and life cycle management strategy while driving US brand objectives to deliver & support NS company and Therapeutic area goals.
  • Responsible for assuring franchise, LCM, and brand strategies to support the delivery of overall financial and strategic goals of the Neuroscience business.
  • Exerts marketing and business influence on the overall NS board agenda while serving as a critical member of the NS Leadership Team and Board while shaping Janssen North America plans as a member of the J&J Innovative Medicine Commercial leadership Board.
  • Develops strategic direction and execution plans for future product indications and overall marketing organization team organization capability and design.
  • Pursues and proposes potential external Business Development opportunities and internal J&J partnerships to strengthen the Neuroscience business in partnership with Business Development, Global Commercial Strategy, and Finance.
  • Identifies and implements transformational strategies and End to End business models that align with the business and therapeutic area growth plans.
  • Assures adherence to CREDO, Business Conduct Policy & Quality and Compliance guidelines.
  • Provide leadership, direction, and assures adherence to Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine principles and standards for Commercial (Marketing, Sales, Market Access, Customer & Patient Solutions) Excellence to ensure the development of enterprise commercial leaders of the future.
  • Collaborates effectively with cross functional business partners (Medical Affairs, Regulatory, Market Access & Pricing, Patient Experience and Customer Solutions, Global Commercial Strategy to ensure compliant and integrated business growth plans that create a competitive advantage and shape the external environment.
  • Attracts, develops, and retains a pipeline of diverse and inclusive leaders that thrive in a Values (J&J CREDO) based inclusive Culture.
  • Innovates by fostering and implementing new technology, digitization, and data analytics strategies that help develop competitive capabilities, commercial insights, and operational efficiency.
  • The VP, Marketing and Franchise Strategy, NS has 4 direct reports and a team of 50+ FTEs

Qualifications

  • BS/BA degree in a related field is required and an advanced degree, such as an MBA, is preferred.
  • 15+ years commercial experience on multiple brands, including successful product launch experience and previous P&L management required.
  • Previous sales leadership experience strongly preferred.
  • Additional experience in at least one other relevant functional area (medical affairs, business development, global commercial strategy, market research or analytics, market access, finance, etc.) required.
  • Experience across different Therapeutic Areas preferred. Neuroscience experience helpful.
  • DTC or Consumer experience and experience marketing products in various cycles of the product lifecycle, are desired.
  • Minimum of 5+ years people management experience and demonstrated strong people development skills are required.
  • Candidates must have demonstrated: strong financial acumen, understanding of US payer channels, understanding of end-to-end product development process through patent expiration, clinical acumen,  experience interfacing with customers, and understanding of the patient journey/experience.
  • Proven track record managing across multiple functions with high learning agility required

This position requires up to 30% Domestic travel and is located in Titusville, NJ. Expectation is to be in the office 3 days a week when not traveling.

The target salary for this position is $188,000-$345,000.

Job Title: IT Manager, Tax Technical Product Owner (Duration Based)
Job Description:
Description

Johnson & Johnson is recruiting for an IT Manager, Tax Technical Product Owner for a 2-year duration-based assignment , located in New Brunswick, NJ. Remote work options within the United States may be considered on a case-by-case basis and if approved by the company.

This is a project assignment for the duration of the requisite project work required, which is expected to conclude at or prior to 24 months from your official start date. At management’s discretion the position may be extended

Do you seek big, complex, ambiguous problems? Are you passionate about having a meaningful impact on the experience, effectiveness, and efficiency of your colleagues through innovative technology solutions? Do you want to be a part of a 134-year-old startup?

Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

The Technical Product Owner will work at the intersection of business & technology to define strategies that combine a deep understanding of business goals, challenges, with technology solutions and extending them into development execution, value realization & ongoing product management.

You will support the tax technology products such as Vertex / DART / SAP Finance (S/4 Hana) but not limited to.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Vision & Strategy Definition : shaping a ‘future proof’ tax business vision, strategy & capability roadmaps, and corresponding technology strategy & product roadmaps with significant decision-making latitude.
  • Business Problem Definition : understanding and translating business problems faced by the tax function into a value case & comprehensive set of solutions spanning process, technology, data, governance & user experience.
  • Solution Design: ensuring that product development efforts incorporate an approach that starts with experimentation to validate expected impact, includes human centered design, Automation to reduce run cost, adopts agile principles, incorporates external insights, required end to end process optimizations, and compliance engagement.
  • Product Management: work in a product management environment to ensure roadmaps are oriented to deliver finance business & technology strategy, value creation objectives, and measurable key performance indicators.
  • External Partnerships: leading vendor relationships and ensure that our needs will be met by our technology partners.

We believe that experience developing insight led strategy, crafting innovative technology solutions, experimentation, agile ways of working, intellectual curiosity, empathy, leading teams are crucial to enable you to be successful in this role. Furthermore, it is important that you are a great collaborator, who has the leadership presence to influence results and build a strong sense of collective team engagement.

Reporting to the Director, you would partner closely with Business Process Owners, Global Process Owners, and tax systems leads to enhance the entrepreneurial potential of technology investments.

Qualifications

Required:

  • BA/BS degree is required.
  • 5+ years of related experience working with Vertex or DART or SAP ECC6 FI/CO or S/4 HANA Finance.
  • Technical expertise in at least one of the following areas: SAP Central Finance, Cloud infrastructure, Data strategy, governance, technology, or process definition.
  • Strong leadership, communication and interpersonal skills.

Preferred:

  • Master’s Degree with focus on Computer Science or Computer Engineering; Economics or Financial Accounting; MBA
  • Experience with all aspects of the product development lifecycle as well as Agile methodology.
  • Experience in leading technical and / or finance teams; strong team-building skills.
  • Tax/Accounting/Finance knowledge and related certifications.
  • Experience with Project Management.

Other:

  • Maximum of 20% business travel expected.

The anticipated base pay range for this position is $99,000 - $170,000.

The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis.

    • Holiday pay, including Floating Holidays – up to 13 days per calendar year

Job Title: Thought Leader Liaison, Medical Oncology - Northwest
Job Description:
Description

Johnson & Johnson is recruiting for a field-based Thought Leader Liaison, Medical Oncology to support the Northwest region. This is a field-based position, with preference for the candidate to reside in the assigned region with easy access to a national airport.

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/ .

The Thought Leader Liaison-PM, Medical Oncology will be responsible for leading the Northwest Key Opinion Leader (KOL) engagement strategy, as well as contributing to the overall KOL strategy across the GU Portfolio Brand in close collaboration with brand team.

The Thought Leader Liaison will:

  • Lead the development and execution of Regional KOL engagement strategy, marketing education strategy and faculty development. This includes oversight of regional peer to peer marketing plans, health care compliance training for faculty, and other related activities as needed.
  • Serve as a key member of the GU Portfolio Brand team by providing local market insights and feedback to shape future strategies for the GU Portfolio Brands in close collaboration with sales leaders, key business partners, and medical teams to elevate brand advocacy.
  • Build trusting strategic partnerships with academic and community KOLs, and other key stakeholders to achieve above-brand priorities.
  • Closely coordinate regional marketing education and engagement plans with cross functional partners to ensure heightened KOL and customer engagement strategies that are fully aligned to the Brand strategic imperatives.
  • Partner with integrated analytics and commercial excellences team to better understand regional variations in treatment patterns to inform peer to peer and insight program placement.
  • Closely monitor the regional marketing education budget and provide continuous feedback on business planning.
  • Maintain pulse on Regional disease state trends and treatment paradigm to identify opportunities to collaborate on common objectives to improve healthcare and patient outcomes.
  • Maintain complete understanding of ACCME/HCC/PhRMA Guidelines

Qualifications

  • BA/BS Degree in a related field; MBA, MD, PharmD, PhD or other related graduate degree preferred.
  • Minimum 4 years of experience in marketing, medical, key account management or sales engaging with HCPs and professional healthcare organizations
  • Experience working cross functionally with various key internal & external stakeholders with the demonstrated ability to create manage strategic partnerships.
  • Demonstrated understanding of industry trends, recognize opportunities to enhance our position competitively, with a strong focus on patient impact and exceptional customer centricity.
  • A valid driver’s license issued in the United States is required.
  • Travel can be up to 65% to field-based events (many occurring on weekends) This includes internal meetings, advisory boards, medical meetings, congresses, and select program attendance.

Preferred:

  • Previous cross-functional industry experience in pharma or biotech.
  • Medical/scientific knowledge/experience with an understanding of the healthcare marketplace.
  • Experience leading through change and transformation with strong leadership skills.
  • Oncology experience is preferred.

The base pay range for this position is $99,000 to $170,200. The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan.  The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year.  Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis. This position is eligible for a company car through the Company’s FLEET program. Employees may be eligible to participate in Company employee benefit programs such as health insurance, savings plan, pension plan, disability plan, vacation pay, sick time, holiday pay, and work, personal and family time off in accordance with the terms of the applicable plans. Additional information can be found through the link below. Information on benefits can be viewed by following this link:  https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits

Job Title: Senior Process Engineer
Job Description:
Description

Johnson & Johnson is currently recruiting for a Senior Process Engineer!

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

Are you interested in making a difference in a thriving diverse company culture, that celebrates the uniqueness of our employees and is committed to inclusion Apply today!

This role provides engineering support for manufacturing operations based within the value streams. The role requires technical ownership to be taken for manufacturing processes, products, and equipment, while maintaining a focus on key business drivers, which include EH&S, Quality, Supply and Cost.

This role provides process engineering and controls support. Plans and conducts activities related to the development of new processes including researching current and emerging technologies, evaluating process cost, quality, and capability alternatives, and performing process characterization and optimization using designed experiments, and problem solving and decision-making tools.

As process owner, this role will involve collaborating with a number of functional groups delivering value stream projects, such as NPI and Manufacturing Engineering, as well as with suppliers and other sites within the engineering, science, and technology network that run similar processes. This position will foster opportunities, strong leadership, work ethic, and Credo-based behaviors.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Under limited supervision and in accordance with all applicable federal, state and local laws/regulations and Corporate Johnson & Johnson, procedures and guidelines, this position:

o   Designs comprehensive engineering activities to develop and implement effective, high-quality processes and design guidelines for dissemination throughout the division.

o   Provides complex design reviews and feedback for improvements in manufacturability.

o   Develops equipment, materials, and process performance requirements, performs vendor searches and equipment evaluation to ensure adequate capability to produce quality products in required quantities at effective costs.

o   Designs experiments and capability studies, develops process specifications, and designs and procures process tooling.

o   Analyzes new processes and equipment with the intent of achieving continuous improvement of present methods.

o   Communicates and monitors process and material quality targets.

o   Measures performance to targets and implements remedial actions as instructed.

o   Develops process documentation and training materials for new processes, materials, and equipment.

o   Support the timely execution of quality actions related to scrap, holds, audit, NCR, and CAPA

o   Support daily operations through attendance at pulse walks and the timely closure of actions.

o   Support of Internal Audit, External Audit, and NC action plans

o   Support attainment of key business metrics through the provision of engineering support for value stream processes.

o   Support elimination of safety and quality risks in the process through implementation of robust engineering solutions.

o   Actively promote a safety culture

o   Design & develop tools, fixtures, gauges, and special equipment for manufacturing operations in conjunction with toolroom technicians and outside vendors.

o   Provide timely and accurate reporting on project activities ensuring projects are delivered to agreed timelines.

o   Identify and lead cost and technical improvements under the department’s continuous improvement program.

o   Responsible for communicating business related issues or opportunities to next management level

o   Responsible for mentoring entry level engineering team members and co-op students

o   For those who supervise or manage a staff, responsible for ensuring that subordinates follow all Company guidelines related to Health, Safety and Environmental practices and that all resources needed to do so are available and in good condition, if applicable

o   Responsible for ensuring personal and Company compliance with all Federal, State, local and Company regulations, policies, and procedures

o   Performs other duties assigned as needed

Qualifications

Qualifications

Education: Minimum of a Bachelor’s and/or equivalent University Degree required;  Master's degree in an Engineering/Technical field preferred

Experience & Skills

Required:

  • Minimum two (2) years of relevant professional work experience
  • Project Management experience
  • Troubleshooting skills
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to work independently
  • Knowledge of statistical process control
  • Demonstrated continuous improvement approach
  • Demonstrated leadership skills and the ability to make effective decisions
  • Demonstrated ability to prioritize multiple assignments or projects with sound analytical, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills
  • Experience in medical device clean room processing & controls monitoring
  • Knowledge of process waste- water treatment & associated regulation
  • Fundamental knowledge of Reverse Osmosis water systems

Preferred:

  • Experience in a medical device manufacturing is preferred but not required
  • Knowledge of CNC
  • ERP systems experience (SAP preferred)
  • 3D Cad experience
  • Document control experience (Windchill preferred)
  • Laser etch equipment experience including troubleshooting

Other:

  • May require up to 10% domestic and/or international travel to other locations and sites
  • Must be willing to support all shifts

Job Title: Associate Director, Field Access & Affordability Solutions-Oncology (Horsham, PA/Titusville, NJ)
Job Description:
Description

Associate Director, Field Access & Affordability Solutions Oncology

About Us

At Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine (JJIM), what matters most is helping people live full and healthy lives. We focus on treating, curing, and preventing some of the most devastating and complex diseases of our time. And we pursue the most promising science, wherever it might be found.

Job Description

Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine’s Patient Engagement and Customer Solutions (PECS) team is recruiting for a home office-based, Associate Director, Field Access & Affordability Solutions Oncology position within the Patient Engagement and Customer Solutions (PECS) organization, whose goal is to create more personalized, seamless, and supportive experiences to help patients start and stay on treatments across the portfolio.

Skills Required:

  • Has high tolerance for ambiguity, enjoys innovating and pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, and has a deep service orientation, empathy, and passion for patients
  • Has passion for driving large-scale transformation; is comfortable working in a highly matrixed org; has comfort with shaping digital solutions; and has experience with patient/customer experience (any industry, not necessarily pharma)

PECS talent will develop critical skills in areas including:

  • Shaping strategy
  • Innovation across the value chain
  • Large-scale business transformation
  • Leading in a matrixed environment
  • Market access acumen

The Associate Director (AD), Field-Based Access & Affordability Solutions will be responsible for leadership of 2 direct reports that support Field Reimbursement Manager (FRM) field operations and FRM launch strategy and execution. The AD position will involve identifying and pursuing opportunities to enhance patient access to Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine products to deliver a best-in-class, personalized patient experience. The ideal candidate must have a high intellectual curiosity, demonstrate an ability to distill and prioritize key insights, and develop and execute on patient focused strategy and tactics. The individual should also have a track record of success with innovation that will contribute to a seamless customer experience in helping patients start and stay on Janssen therapies.

A Day in the Life

Every patient’s healthcare experience is unique – shaped by personal experiences and beliefs, the presence or absence of support networks, provider and payer dynamics, and socioeconomic factors. For many patients, the decision to start or stop a treatment is overwhelming. Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine recognizes this, and wants to create an experience that is personalized, helpful, and hopeful.

The Associate Director, Field-Based Access & Affordability Solutions will work to elevate the patient impact of our Oncology Field Reimbursement team. Their day-to-day responsibilities include:

  • Field Reimbursement KPIs and Initiatives: Develop and monitor KPIs that support patient fulfillment. Foster collaboration between FRM and other customer or patient facing teams including field sales, Janssen CarePath Care Coordination, etc. Manage budget allocations related to field team training, recruiting, headcount, and related investments.
  • Partner Collaboration: Partner with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders to pull in relevant strategy and enhance FRM value. Stakeholders include: FRM teams or equivalent in other Therapeutic Areas, Oncology Marketing, Patient Experience Leads, PECS Solutions Teams, Field Sales, Sales Learning & Development, Commercial Insights & Strategy, Legal, Regulatory, HCC, and outside vendors.
  • Insight Generation: Anticipate market and competitive trends and articulate insights to inform FRM program evolution. Understand the desired customer experience and create open lines of communication about gaps & opportunities in the customer journey. Generate insights to inform training, deployment, and prioritization of activities.
  • Upskilling & Tools: Shape and launch FRM resources and trainings that support a simple and meaningful approach to meeting customer unmet fulfillment needs, inclusive of full management of CPC, CAC, and MRC reviews. Develop and coordinate launch execution plans for new assets and pull through on key priorities. Define and track metrics that set FRM teams up for success with creating the desired customer experience.
  • Culture: Cultivate a mindset that fosters innovation, agility, smart risk-taking, and experimentation by identifying and socializing best practices, well-intended failures, and ex-pharma examples of creating value through experience; help to identify necessary changes in the internal ecosystem in which we operate that must evolve and change to support our efforts.
  • Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion: Create an inclusive environment in support of the company’s commitment to equal employment opportunity and the value of a diverse work force.
  • Leadership & Ethics: Model ethical, Credo-based leadership with deep knowledge and respect for legal and compliance requirements.

This is not an exhaustive, comprehensive listing of job functions (may perform other duties as assigned).

Qualifications

  • A minimum of a Bachelor's degree is required
  • A minimum of five (5) years business experience, including experience in Sales, Marketing, Account Management, Operations, Analytics and/or related fields is required
  • Direct people management, field management, or participation in a Management Development Program experience is required
  • Practical knowledge and experience with health insurance and access & reimbursement landscape including FDA regulatory and legal environment and HCC regulations required
  • Oncology experience required

Strong Business Acumen : Innovative, proactive, and strong analytically with excellent overall business acumen. Experience in Immunology or other specialty market is preferred. Knowledge of specialty pharmacy providers and Biologic therapies access and reimbursement required

Strategic Thinking: Must be able to demonstrate ability to think strategically and successfully operate in two worlds - big picture orientation with attention to detail.

Communication. Strong verbal and written communication skills including the ability to simplify the complex, connect with an audience, and effectively use communication to influence and engage across all levels of the organization.

Relationship building. Excellent interpersonal skills with a demonstrated track record for forging strong, productive relationships with a diverse array of stakeholders and colleagues.

Collaboration. Effectively work in a team environment that will require you to coordinate activities and build partnerships across multiple internal/external organizations, as well as influence without authority when partnering cross-functionally.

Accountability. Eager to set ambitious goals and take ownership for results. Proactive defining actions and following through. Capable of managing and prioritizing multiple priorities.

Flexibility. Can dynamically adjust priorities due to changing circumstances.  An agile learner who is comfortable operating in complex environment.

Travel. This position will split time between Horsham, PA and Titusville, NJ and requires up to 25% domestic travel.

The base pay range for this position is $118,000 to $203,550.  The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs.  Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus.  The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year.  Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis.  Employees may be eligible to participate in Company employee benefit programs such as health insurance, savings plan, pension plan, disability plan, vacation pay, sick time, holiday pay, and work, personal and family time off in accordance with the terms of the applicable plans.  Additional information can be found through the link below.

Information on benefits can be viewed by following this link: https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits

Job Title: Group Product Director, Patient/Nurse Marketing, TECVAYLI
Job Description:
Description

Johnson & Johnson is recruiting for a Group Product Director, Patient/Nurse Marketing, TECVAYLI located in Horsham, PA.

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

The GPD will lead all aspects of Patient/Nurse Marketing & Strategy for TECVAYLI.  This individual will be responsible for a small team of marketers focused on the patient, caregiver and patient care team audiences.  This person will be accountable for meeting key strategic objectives of the brand, and contributing to revenue performance in the U.S.

Responsibilities

The GPD will be directly responsible for all aspects of the TECAVYLI patient experience including brand education to patients/caregivers, DTP/DTC advertising, and advocacy relations.  The GPD will be responsible for strategies to improve both start and stay aspects of the patient experience, where the patient care team members are a critical stakeholder. This individual will also be responsible for partnering with the GPD Market Access and Patient Engagement and Customer Solutions (PECS) team to ensure optimal access and financial support for the brand patients while also demonstrating leadership & partnership across the Multiple Myeloma portfolio.

Additional responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following:

  • Develop and oversee execution of patient education strategy, including media and digital strategy, asset creation (branded and unbranded)
  • Lead development of integrated and multi-channel DTP/DTC campaign
  • Manage consumer/patient agency of record and other specialty agencies
  • Partner with Advocacy team to implement advocacy strategy and integrate across HCP and Payer teams to maximize value of those partnerships
  • Partner with PR/Communications team on external communications initiatives and signature campaigns related to patients
  • Partner across brand GPDs and key PECS & SCG partners to address affordability and patient access pain points and develop prioritized solutions targeting patient and patient care team key stakeholders
  • Manage Patient/Nurse Experience budget, including team budget management
  • Oversee tactical execution of direct reports; Provide coaching, development, and day-to-day management of direct report.

This individual must demonstrate strong leadership presence through influencing without authority with high-level management, detail orientation, and excellent strategic thinking. This position requires extensive interactions with multiple stakeholders.

Qualifications

  • A minimum of a Bachelor's degree is required. Postgraduate qualification, PhD, MBA, or other graduate degree is preferred.
  • A minimum of 8 years of business experience with a minimum of 5 years demonstrated in-line marketing, sales or sales management/training experience executing marketing strategy is required.
  • A demonstrated ability to partner and work with multiple agencies/vendors, manage budgets and projects, cross-functionally, and with cross-company teams of high-level managers and executives is required.
  • A demonstrated ability to manage multiple demands and priorities on time, lead teams, gain alignment and driving decision making is required.
  • Demonstrated ability to formally manage, coach, and develop direct reports is strongly preferred.
  • Prior experience in patient/consumer marketing and oncology is preferred.
  • Strong verbal, written and executive communication skills are required along with demonstrated presentation skills.
  • Senior brand responsibility, people management, product launch, and a solid understanding of pharmaceutical development is preferred.
  • This position is in Horsham, PA and requires up to 25% travel.

Description

Janssen Biotech, Inc., a member of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting for a Senior Thought Leader Liaison, Lung to support the Mid-West region. This is a field-based position, with preference for the candidate to reside in the assigned region with easy access to a national airport.

The Sr. Thought Leader Liaison – PD, Lung will be responsible for leading the Mid-West Key Opinion Leader (KOL) engagement strategy, as well as contributing significantly to the overall KOL strategy to expand engagement capabilities with innovation solutions across the Lung Portfolio. This position requires close collaboration with the Brand teams, sales leaders, key business partners, and medical teams to elevate brand advocacy. This role requires demonstrated ability to thrive in a dynamic environment with strong focus on patient impact and exceptional customer centricity. Position will require greater than 50% travel (can be up to 65% travel) to field based educational events (many occurring on weekends). This includes internal meetings, advisory boards, medical meetings, congresses, and select program attendance.

Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following:

  • Lead the development and execution of Regional KOL engagement strategy, marketing education strategy and faculty development. This includes oversight of regional peer to peer marketing plans, health care compliance training for faculty, and other related activities as needed.
  • Serve as a key member of the RYBREVANT Brand team by providing local market insights and feedback to shape future strategies for the RYBREVANT Brand.
  • Build trusting relationships with academic and community KOLs, and other key stakeholders to achieve above-brand priorities.
  • Maintain pulse on Regional Lung Cancer trends and closely coordinate Regional marketing education and engagement plans with cross functional partners to ensure heightened KOL and customer engagement strategies that are fully aligned to the Brand strategic imperatives.
  • Partner with integrated analytics team to better understand Regional variations in treatment patterns to inform peer to peer and insight program placement.
  • Closely monitor the Regional marketing budget and provide continuous feedback on business planning.
  • Assist in shaping future innovative educational platforms including national and regional recommendations to tailor our education to local needs and creating innovative solutions in further engaging KOL’s at all regional and national medical congresses.
  • Leadership of the overall brand strategy inclusive of mapping, framework development, innovative engagement planning for current brands and future launches, inclusive of marketing operations for KOL strategy and planning including agency management, champion materials through CAC, Totality, MRC.
  • Partner with Commercial Excellence to develop tools to inform placement of insight generation and 3rd party placement.
  • Potentially manage other oncology TLLs to increase capabilities, meet development needs and maximize the impact on key initiatives.
  • Maintain complete understanding of ACCME/HCC/PhRMA Guidelines.

Qualifications

Requirements:

  • A minimum of a BA/BS Degree in a related field is required; MBA, MD, PharmD, PhD or other related graduate degree preferred.
  • A minimum of 6 years of experience in marketing, medical, key account management, sales, or sales leadership, ideally engaging with KOLs/Influential HCPs and professional healthcare organizations.
  • Deep understanding and experience working cross functionally with various key internal & external stakeholders with a strong ability to innovate, collaborate and deliver results with desired outcomes.
  • Demonstrated understanding of key industry trends and ability to develop strategies to stay ahead of the competition and maximize patient outcomes.
  • Demonstrated ability to build and manage relevant and lasting customer relationships with strong focus on patient impact and outstanding customer centricity.
  • A valid driver's license issued in the United States is required.
  • This position requires greater than 50% travel (can be up to 65% travel) to field based educational events, internal meetings, congresses, and select program attendance (many occurring on weekends).

Preferred:

  • Previous cross-functional industry experience in pharma or biotech engaging with KOLs and professional healthcare associations is preferred.
  • Deep medical/scientific knowledge/experience with a firm understanding of the oncology marketplace is preferred.
  • Experience leading through change and transformation, and exceptional communication and leadership skills is preferred.
  • Oncology experience highly preferred.

The base pay range for this position is $118,000 to $203,550. The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan.  The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year.  Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis. This position is eligible for a company car through the Company’s FLEET program. Employees may be eligible to participate in Company employee benefit programs such as health insurance, savings plan, pension plan, disability plan, vacation pay, sick time, holiday pay, and work, personal and family time off in accordance with the terms of the applicable plans.   • Deep understanding and experience working cross functionally with various key internal & external stakeholders with a strong ability to innovate, collaborate and deliver results with desired outcomes.
  • Demonstrated understanding of key industry trends and ability to develop strategies to stay ahead of the competition and maximize patient outcomes.
  • Demonstrated ability to build and manage relevant and lasting customer relationships with strong focus on patient impact and outstanding customer centricity.
  • A valid driver's license issued in the United States is required.
  • This position requires greater than 50% travel (can be up to 65% travel) to field based educational events, internal meetings, congresses, and select program attendance (many occurring on weekends).

Preferred:

  • Previous cross-functional industry experience in pharma or biotech engaging with KOLs and professional healthcare associations is preferred.
  • Deep medical/scientific knowledge/experience with a firm understanding of the oncology marketplace is preferred.
  • Experience leading through change and transformation, and exceptional communication and leadership skills is preferred.
  • Oncology experience highly preferred.

Job Title: Field Service Contracts Administrator
Job Description:
Description

Johnson & Johnson is currently seeking a Field Service Contract Administrator to join our Field Service team located in Danvers with a hyrbid schedule.

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/ .

The Service Contracts Administrator will assist in multiple areas within the Operations department and will be responsible for leading all aspects of service contract entry, reporting, and data analysis.  They will also be responsible for working with the service teams to ensure the timely and accurate service execution for the Danvers service depot for all required preventative maintenance by ensuring timely close and entry of all new and expiring service contracts over all products.  Other duties will include support for service-related activities described below.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:

·       Track and report periodically to management the progress of each inside sales representative to ensure timely close rates in alignment with service that is due and prior to existing contract expirations.

·       Develop CRM tools to ensure timely close rates

·       Monitor and report on all sites that are beyond service contract expiration or warranty

·       Enhance current tools for automating existing contract entry to ERP system and integration to SFDC.

·       Support of service operations activities to ensure scalability of current and future service offerings related to service agreements.

·       Support to Finance department related to timely resolution of Service Aging.

·       Develop comprehensive reporting to customer for validation of contract overall ROI.

Qualifications

·       BS/BA Business or Healthcare discipline

·       A minimum of 5 years similar experience

·       Positive attitude, well organized, and detail oriented

·       Excellent communication (both written and oral) & strong customer service skills

·       Execute tasks in a timely manner with minimal supervision

·       Able to prioritize tasks

·       Able to interact well cross-departmentally and with external customers

·       Knowledgeable with regulatory guidelines pertaining to medical device

Preferred Qualifications:

·       Large MRP system knowledge desired, SAP

·       5 years experience of Salesforce desired

·       Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite
